facebook.title: Mother Plants Tell Their Seeds When to Sprout
facebook.summary: "Life events" that happen before plants make their seeds, such as warm vs cool weather, predict characteristics in their offspring. This is what we're learning happens in animals and humans too, through epigenetics

Mother knows best—even if Mom is a plant. A common flowering plant, Arabidopsis, hands down “memories” of recent temperatures to its seeds to prepare them for incoming spring weather conditions, a new study shows.
